Text:
Congratulations to Roberto Ortiz on becoming the first Puerto Rican MLB umpire!

I’m excited to see you in action.

I know that you will make Puerto Rico proud.
https://t.co/V5Zwz7Shdt

Would you like to submit an appropriations request with my office? 

Go to the link below for more information on how to submit your request: 

https://t.co/EiOSrWkG9F

Recibo con mucha tristeza la noticia del fallecimiento de la Lcda. María Dolores Fernós. Los tiempos llaman a honrar su legado continuando la lucha en favor la equidad y por proteger el derecho a decidir de las mujeres. Descansa en poder, Tati.

From an unequal playing field, these athletes became the best in the world. 

Then they took on the long, hard fight to make sure the next generation gets a fairer shot & female athletes get the respect and pay they deserve. 

Bravo! #EqualPay #USWNT

https://t.co/2dQu9wTO2T

Today's ruling shows that Ahmaud Arbery was murdered because of the color of his skin.

Nothing will ever bring him back, but I hope this verdict brings some solace to his loved ones and family.

This is another step towards justice, but we must continue to fight white supremacy. https://t.co/Rk9Fv0Ha0Q
@billieeilish @RepBowman Stream will be up here at 12:30PM! https://t.co/TssP75b3ZW

Got lunch plans? 

Follow along LIVE as @billieeilish joins me & @RepBowman to advocate for the Healthy Future Students and Earth Act to bring more plant-based meals to students.  

Head over to my FB page for a livestream starting at 12:30PM today.
@billieeilish Stream will be up here at 12:30PM! https://t.co/TssP75b3ZW

The #ChildTaxCredit was incredibly popular and successful program because it benefited working families immediately and drastically reduce child poverty.

There should be no debate, it’s time to renew the child tax credit. https://t.co/xGj7uVvsUi
Very sad to hear of the passing of my @HouseSmallBiz colleague, Rep. Hagedorn. My statement below. https://t.co/5l5Oe0lpLC

Protecting our coastal communities from sea level rise is crucial.

The new infrastructure law offers us an opportunity to sustainability fortify our waterfront communities from the devastation of sea level rise.

I’m fighting hard to make sure our communities see the benefits. https://t.co/7fdGmmXVgf

Join myself, @RepJeffries, and @RepYvetteClarke right now as we host a virtual resume building and career opportunity workshop tonight from until 5:30 pm. 

More details below: https://t.co/cThc3sJSY1

The majority of this student debt falls on the shoulders of Black and Brown students. 

Canceling student debt would not only provide young people with a better opportunity to succeed, but help to ensure racial justice. 

We must cancel student debt. https://t.co/mp9ik6hU64
@NYCHealthSystem For a complete list of locations and to learn more, visit: https://t.co/whzxU6Dez8

Do you want $100 with your free COVID-19 Vaccine or Booster Shot? 

Anyone who gets their first COVID-19 vaccine dose or booster shot at an @NYCHealthSystem location between February 12 & February 28 can get a pre-paid debit card, gift voucher, or free tickets to NYC attractions.

Echo my colleague @RepGraceMeng. This was a horrific attack in Chinatown against an innocent woman who tragically lost her life. 

My prayers are with her family and loved ones. We must do more to combat racially motivated hate and violence across all levels of government. https://t.co/vj6Xm0Up9G

We need justice for Khandaker Modassar of Cypress Hills, Brooklyn. For all the victims of senseless gun violence. 

This is not a red or blue issue. These are real human lives being lost in all of our communities. 

Congress must pass stronger gun violence prevention laws.

I echo @LincolnRestler in sending my heart and prayers to the family of the construction worker who lost their life today in BK Heights. 

There must be an investigation to ensure this was not the failure of safety measure enforcement. If so, there must be accountability. https://t.co/NZtL5JEuS7

In recent weeks we have seen a rise in hate crimes & this is incident is the latest example.

The people committing these acts of hate must stop.

I will continue to stand with members of our community & show that we are united against hatred—my office will continue to monitor. https://t.co/IuEK5tEhfY
要申請援助，請訪問：https://t.co/dCEiDJoZlu 或致電紐約州房主援助基金1-844-77-NYHAF
您是否因為疫情所造成的經濟困境而面臨房貸違約，欠交地稅，管理費等等流離失所的風險？請立即申請紐約州房主援助基金 (NYHAF)，該基金將在 2 月 18 日星期五截至接受新申請。在此日期之後遞交的申請會被HAF放入候補名單。如果將來有餘剩的資金，該計劃將接受候補名單中的申請人。
Para solicitar asistencia visite: https://t.co/dCEiDJoZlu o contacte al centro de llamadas del Fondo de Asistencia para Propietarios en el 1-844-77-NYHAF.

que estará aceptando solicitudes hasta el viernes 18 de febrero. Después de esa fecha el programa pasara a ser por lista de espera. Si en un futuro se designan más fondos para el programa, entonces se aceptarían solicitantes de la lista de espera.

¿Estás en riesgo de incumplimiento, ejecución de hipoteca o desplazamiento debido a la pandemia y los retos asociados a ello? Solicita hoy al Fondo de Asistencia para Propietarios del Estado de Nueva York (NYHAF por sus siglas en inglés)

If additional funding becomes available in the future, the program will accept applicants from the waitlist 

To apply for assistance go to: https://t.co/dCEiDJoZlu or contact the NYS Homeowner Assistance Fund Call Center to apply at 1-844-77-NYHAF

Are you at risk of default, foreclosure, or displacement due to pandemic related hardship? Apply today for the New York State Homeowners Assistance Fund (NYHAF) which will be accepting new applications until Friday, 2/18. After that, the HAF program will convert to a waitlist.

This week’s #BlackHistoryMonth spotlight is Supreme Court Justice Thurgood Marshall.

During his 25 years on the court, he fought against the death penalty, advocated for civil rights, & supported abortion rights.

We must carry on his mission of equal justice for all. https://t.co/U3bWrxjOXY

For many years, wealthy Mainlanders have been legally allowed to establish themselves as Puerto Rican residents to avoid certain taxes which has made PR especially lucrative for cryptocurrency investors. Watch me question @USTreasury on this issue: https://t.co/HZ7rtjilHu

Today is National Black HIV & Aids Awareness Day.

A day in which we recognize disproportional impact HIV & AIDS has on the Black community. 

We need to continue to work to end the stigma and provide the resources necessary for equal access to treatment and prevention. https://t.co/7uxI6fwwgn

This is not who we are. These disgusting, anti-Semitic, violent attacks on our neighbors must end. 

My office is monitoring and is here for the community. We must mobilize at all levels of government to put an end to this. https://t.co/teQipGNZjF

Today is Rosa Parks’ birthday.

May we honor her legacy of activism and bravery by continuing the work she started to create a more fair and just country for all. 

#RestInPower https://t.co/99qpeRSxbi

Members of Congress shouldn’t be allowed to own stock. Period. 

That’s why I signed onto legislation prohibiting members from owning or trading stocks.

RT if you agree!

This morning, I joined @SenSchumer, @RepJerryNadler, @VOCALNewYork, @DPA_NY, @ImmDefense & @RWDSU to urgently call for comprehensive federal marijuana reform legislation.

It’s time for the federal government to get with the times. https://t.co/2GcutuvCJ1

During #BlackHistoryMonth, I’m spotlighting Black American trailblazers & leaders.

This week’s spotlight is one of my mentors & Brooklyn's very own: Shirley Chisholm.

The first Black woman elected to Congress, she was a strong voice for women's rights & working families in NYC. https://t.co/531w02Ax4G

Behind every member of Congress is a staff working tirelessly as public servants. 

I fully support their right to unionize. #UnionStrong

Today at a meeting with @POTUS and @NYCMayor & other leaders, I recognized @LosSures' anti-violence program in North Brooklyn. They have been effective in taking a community-based holistic approach to solving this crisis. We must put more resources towards programs like these. https://t.co/z10UUmbbLY

We must recognize that mobilizing community-based resources, job opportunities, and early intervention are key to protecting our youth from gun violence. It will take all hands on deck across local, state and federal governments.

Since the start of the pandemic, gun violence in our city has surged to levels not seen in a decade. Shootings are up by 166% here in NYC. Across the U.S., over 20,000 people were killed by gun violence last year alone.

Puerto Rico has been through enough power grid failures. 
 
Its residents need transparency, accountability and a targeted shift toward distributed renewable energy.
 
Read my full op-ed with @ltgrusselhonore here: 

https://t.co/TkrAHItTDG

And that includes @gillibrandny and I! We have so much work to do to end gun violence and it will take a comprehensive approach across all levels of government. https://t.co/WTuzXIvO2I https://t.co/n5tvrjagYI

This morning, I asked about how we can better support LGBTQ+ New Yorkers in securing housing. 

This issue is close to my district and I thank @marcformarc for their powerful testimony on the power of community and fighting the discrimination facing homeless LGBTQ+ New Yorkers. https://t.co/QEoqbXU3y3

The growing gap in pay between CEOs and their average employee is egregious.

My bill, the Greater Accountability in Pay Act, would require public companies to disclose the pay raise percentage of its executives and median-pay employees.

We need to pass this bill. https://t.co/Ogex0DojFv

Republicans were silent when Trump said he was going to nominate a woman to replace RBG but when Biden says he’s going to nominate a Black woman, they are concerned with her qualifications. Let that speak for itself.

It's time to have a Black woman on the Court.
My prayers are with @SenatorLujan and his family. Wishing for a speedy and healthy recovery. https://t.co/65XpbehALI

This #BlackHistoryMonth let us honor and celebrate the impact that Black Americans have made on the country. 

During this month we pay homage to the trailblazers who have shaped culture and the activists that fought to make a more fair and just America. https://t.co/0aWWIfQZGW

Happy #LunarNewYear to all who are celebrating in NYC and around the world! 

Wishing everyone good fortune and health in the #YearoftheTiger. https://t.co/rMKHEHxeUN

War is not the answer for the crisis in Ukraine. 

I’ve joined @USProgressives in a resolution calling for a diplomatic solution instead of war. 

.@POTUS must exercise all available diplomatic avenues for a peaceful solution. 

https://t.co/vz0ESWwSi9
@NewJackKennedy My staff is checking in on this now. Thank you.

Today, we announced this study has gotten $6.7 million in federal funding to identify the best methods for storm damage reduction, coastal resiliency, & flood damage.

We must proactively protect our communities from the climate crisis.
Last year myself and @BillPascrell sent a letter urging the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers to support funding for a New York and New Jersey Harbor and Tributaries focus area study.

During this year’s open enrollment period under @POTUS, we saw the highest number of people signing up for health care ever. 

That’s 14.5 million more Americans with access to quality affordable health care! https://t.co/1kpecoQgHS

There has been tremendous progress so far, but there is still more that needs to be done. 

People in this country and in our communities are reeling—we must do more and we can do more. https://t.co/1QpNYl2gf0

Today, on #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we remember the 6 million Jewish victims of the Holocaust.

As we condemn the vile hatred and anti-Semitism of the past, we must work together to fight back against the rise in anti-Semitic hate crimes that we are seeing now.

#NeverAgain.

An honor to stand with @SenSchumer and environmental justice advocates to announce nearly $25 million in federal funding to advance the SBMT expansion project.

This victory for the community brings us one step closer to a sustainable working waterfront & jobs in Sunset Park. https://t.co/l1mP2mherk

Thank you to Justice Breyer for your years of service to our country on the Supreme Court. 

Now it’s time for @POTUS to deliver on his promise and make history by nominating a Black woman to the Court. https://t.co/MRi6c6mZTC

Since the free at home #COVID19 test program started, I heard from my constituents who can't order their test because they live in multi-family housing unit.

That’s why I’ve joined @RepAOC urging the Admin to expand the standards for the program to include multi-family housing. https://t.co/oRuYI76zXL

I’m sadden to hear that Officer Mora has tragically passed away from his injuries he sustained during last week’s shooting. 

This is utterly heartbreaking, and I will continue to keep his family and loved ones in my prayers. 

https://t.co/uo6Dtyk6CL

This shouldn't come as a shock. The U.S. has undervalued and underinvested in parents and children for too long. 

Lots of changes are needed from paid leave to universal childcare, but the CTC is a great start. I'm fighting to make it permanent. 

https://t.co/4e6stbh9DC

This weekend was the 49th anniversary of #RoeVWade.  

As attacks from Republicans threaten Roe, I was proud to vote for the Women’s Health Protection Act in the House to codify Roe into law.

Just like my speech in 2017, I will continue to speak out against attacks on Roe. https://t.co/STr9ZI1Y0N

One of the most common service connected injuries in our armed forces is hearing loss and tinnitus. 

That is why I Introduced the Hear our Heroes Act, which would help veterans suffering from hearing problems to obtain medical care through the Veterans Health Administration. https://t.co/jhAVnczXrv

This disgusting act of ant-Semitism has absolutely no place in our community and I strongly condemn what has happened.

This is not normal. 

It really uncovers the racist roots of the old boys club that's the leadership of the GOP today.

Wasting no time, proud to announce that President Biden has signed the Puerto Rico Recovery Accuracy in Disclosures Act into law this morning!

https://t.co/rdA6pERYKJ
If you don’t want to listen to me about the importance of voting rights, listen to a man that dedicated his life to this cause, John Lewis. https://t.co/9SW4mF9hNf

This bipartisan bill ensures the integrity of the PROMESA process and will bring welcome transparency and confidence in the island’s future. Thank you to @SenatorMenendez for your hard work in the Senate to get this done!

By applying a disclosure requirement to all PROMESA Title III proceedings and eliminating a double standard, this bill will help to restore confidence that the Board’s bankruptcy advisors do not have their thumb on the scale to favor certain debts where they have a self-interest
I am so proud that today, the House has taken the final step to send my bill, the Puerto Rico Recovery Accuracy in Disclosures Act to the President’s desk to be signed into law!

Ha sido un gran honor luchar mano a mano por estos fondos junto a Enlace y al G-8. Seguiré pendiente al desembolso de este financiamiento y me aseguraré que se tome acción pronto, los residentes del Caño no tienen pq esperar ni un día más por la justicia ambiental que merecen.

¡Por fin ha llegado el día que se le hace justicia al Caño! Después de nuestra comunicación al Cuerpo de Ingenieros, hoy se anuncian $163 millones para el Caño. Gracias a @senschumer por trabajar conmigo y a @POTUS por cumplir su promesa.

Durante muchos años he luchado desde múltiples frentes para asegurar el financiamiento para lograr la restauración del Caño Martin Peña y hoy estoy súper esperanzada de lo que esta noticia significa para las comunidades del Caño.

I thank @POTUS for showing up for PR, and it has been an honor fighting for these funds alongside Enlace and the G-8. I'll continue to monitor the rollout of this funding to ensure action is taken as soon as possible—the people cannot wait any longer for environmental justice.

As I said when @SenSchumer and I wrote last week urging the Army Corps to select this project, the Infrastructure & Investment Jobs Act is a clear opportunity to right the social & environmental injustices that those living along this polluted canal in have suffered for decades.

For years, I’ve been fighting to pursue every avenue possible to secure federal funding to restore the Caño Martín Peña and I am overjoyed for the communities that it will finally be put into motion. (THREAD)

https://t.co/OGvnLL5GjV

The right to vote needs to be ensured guaranteed for all.

What’s standing in the way are two Democratic Senators. 

History is watching Senators, will you act?

I continue to encourage NYCHA to reach out to city & state partners to ask for resources as we work to do so at the federal level. 

All hands need to be on deck.

A tragic, tragic day. https://t.co/RH6Q3cUlpr

Proud to announce that thanks to the bipartisan infrastructure law & @POTUS, New York will receive $378.4 million this year to help rebuild over 1,700 bridges that are in poor condition. 

Over 5 years NYS will see $1.9 billion.

Step one of infrastructure funding at work!

FEMA just cancelled $371 million in the repayment of community disaster loans for Puerto Rico. This will go a long way towards alleviating the strain on local municipalities. Glad to work with an Administration that is showing up for the Island!

Last summer, I asked the @USFWS to declare Los Almendros Beach in Rincón, Puerto Rico as a critical habitat for endangered hawksbill and sea turtles. In a response they told me they are assessing & share the concerns. 

We will keep pressing. https://t.co/W8okFrF4Kb

.@usmint has released the Maya Angelou quarter!
 
For too long, women who have contributed to American history have gone unrecognized—especially women of color. I’m proud to have supported @RepBarbaraLee’s bill to honor phenomenal women who inspire us to live a purposeful life. https://t.co/2MOfNHu4YS

Protecting the very foundation of our democracy shouldn’t be a radical idea, or partisan. 

I’m proud to stand with @HouseDemocrats in the fight enact the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act and the Freedom to Vote Act, because our democracy is at stake.

In light of recent fires in NYC it is crucial that we implement resources that could prevent these tragedies. 

I’m proud to cosponsor @RepBonnie’s bill the Public Housing Fire Safety Act to take a step in the right direction to prevent catastrophic fires in public housing.

纽约州房主援助基金门户网站已经开放，并接受符合条件的房主的申请，这些房主因疫情而面临违约，丧失房产抵押赎回权或流离失所的风险。

Eligible applicants may apply for a maximum payment of $50,000 in relief.

I fully support the work of the Select Committee on the January 6th Attack on the Capitol to shed light on the truth, hold all responsible for the attack accountable, and prevent any such act from ever happening again.

The attempt by former President Trump to subvert our democracy by propagating the big lie that he won the election and inciting a violent mob to overthrow the certification of election results cannot go unpunished.
who were put in a grave position yet fought with everything they had to protect those inside the Capitol and the very foundation of our democracy.
As someone who was at the Capitol on January 6th, let me say that we all owe a great amount of debt to the Capitol Police and surrounding law enforcement officers

January 6th, 2021 will forever go down as one of the darkest days in our history. On this solemn anniversary, my heart is with all who bore witness to the horrific scene that day—members of Congress, staff, employees, and every American who watched in shock on the news. (THREAD)

#Jan6th, will go down as one of the darkest days in our history.

On that painful day we remember the Capitol Police who fought to protect the foundation of our democracy.

Today as we all relive the trauma, know you're not alone & we must work to ensure this never happens again.
